newsitem.title: PORTUGAL: Portuguese premier visits former African colony.
newsitem.headline: Portuguese premier visits former African colony.

text.p: Portuguese Prime Minister Antonio Guterres left on Sunday for a five-day visit to the Cape Verde islands, a former Portuguese colony off the coast of west Africa, officials said.

The visit, Guterres' first to Africa since taking office in October 1995, is aimed at tightening commercial and cultural links between the two fellow members of the Commonwealth of Portuguese-speaking Countries (CPLP).
The premier was accompanied by four ministers and a high-ranking delegation of businessmen, including the chairman of the state telecommunications company Portugal Telecom and leading bankers.
